preamble: In this section you will descibe acquisition set-up, which software you have used, impedance upper treschold, what type of online reference, recording channels, VEOG and HEOG and online filters.
question: What software did you use for the acquisition?
Specify software version if applicable, and software name and version if "other" was selected.
Did you document impedances, or an alternative data aquisition quality measure?
What is the appropriate acquisition data quality measure for your recording equipment?
choices: impedance upper threshold | impedance range | a data quality measure alternative to impedances

question: What was the upper threshold of impedance that you registered in your study?
What was the lowest impedance you registered in this study?
What was the highest impedance you registered in this study?
Report data quality measures provided by your recording system alternative to impedances.
What type of placement/naming convention have you used for the electrode locations?
choices: five percent electrode system (extension of the International 10-20 system by Oostenveld & Praamstra (2001)) | commercial geodesic net | other named system | custom locations

question: Specify the electrode placement/naming convention used
details: Either the name of a standardized placement system (for example, 10-20) or a list of standardized electrode names (for example, [Cz, Pz])

question: Describe the custom placement of your electrodes relative to anatomical markers or electrode naming/placement systems
details: E.g. "One electrode, half way between Cz and CP1, was used."

question: In a later version of the app you will be able to upload here your electrode location file to report the exact position.
choices: great! | bring it on! | no need...

question: Number of scalp electrodes including reference channels, but excluding ground channel, VEOG and HEOG.
Did you use an online reference (as opposed to alternative solutions such as Driven Right Leg (DRL))?
Where did you place reference electrode(s)?
What alternative to an online reference (for example DRL) did you use? Please describe it.
Online reference location other than listed
Where did you place ground electrode during the recording?
How many EOG channels did you use to record eye movement-dependent voltage?
choices: two HEOG channels only | two VEOG channels only | two HEOG and two VEOG channels | no EOG channels | other

question: Specify the position of EOG channels you used for the recording
details: For example, where were they placed? How were they positioned in ajdunct to the rest of the electrodes?

question: Which of the following online filters have you used?
choices: high pass | low pass | pass band | stop band | notch | none

question: Specify the high-pass filter cut-off used during recording.
Type of high-pass filter cut-off
Specify the high-pass filter roll off used during recording
Type of low-pass filter cut-off
Specify the low-pass filter cut-off used during recording.
Specify the low-pass filter roll off used during recording
What online notch filter have you applied after the recording?
Describe the stopband frequency of the online notch filter you applied
What was your acquisition sampling rate?
